summary: Anonymous chat application with all caller principal checks removed from user-facing actions
architectural_notes: All user-facing backend functions must operate without caller principal checks or authentication requirements
Session IDs stored in localStorage manage anonymous user state
Admin functions may remain password-protected but should not use Internet Identity or caller principal checks
known_issues: Caller principal checks currently blocking all user actions on live site
AccessControl.isAuthorized() calls preventing anonymous users from creating rooms, sending messages, and other basic functions

new_feature_requests.summary: Remove all AccessControl.isAuthorized() calls from user-facing functions in backend/main.mo including createChatroom, sendMessage, addReaction, removeReaction, updateUsername, updateAvatar, addReply, and any other functions that regular users need to access
Preserve admin password-protected functions (deleteChatroom and any other admin-only operations) so they remain protected

projectName: Remove all caller principal checks from user-facing backend functions
